p: The adult group of patients with asthma diverges into several different phenotypes, likely representing various diseases. Asthma is often said to be a syndrome rather than one disease. Different phenotypes may have varying responses to viral infection. A cluster analysis divided asthma patients into five different groups. One group, “benign asthma” seemed to have well-controlled symptoms regardless of triggers, viral or ­otherwise. Another group that was female preponderant, “obese nonesosinophilic,” had minimal atopy or eosinophilic inflammation yet a high level of symptoms in response to typical triggers ( 36).
